title: San Serif, Slightly Geometric Font--Circa 1950s? Used for signage
content:
For my typeface design class I'm planning on developing a font based around this photograph of a sign I found online. Before I begin, I was curious to see if it was an actual font, or personally designed for Kenmore Lanes.

As I was doing some sketches I found it has a similarity to Futura, but the r, k, and e tell me it's not.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419145110im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kenmoretwo_6384.jpg)
author: kate_monstah

comments.content: This is lettering. But you might find some similarities in [Dessau Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419145110/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/dessau_pro/) from Fountain.

the lettering is nice already.. but if you want to change it.. then it's all up to you..  
 [get twitter followers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419145110/http:/www.buysocialnow.com/twitter/followers)
